alert.note: Alert for Loudon; Northwest Monroe; Roane (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 3:10PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Loudon, northwestern Monroe and southeastern Roane Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 410 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Loudon, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lenoir City, Sweetwater, Loudon, Madisonville, Vonore, Greenback, Philadelphia, Paint Rock, Fort Loudon State Park and McGee Carson Peninsula. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
